body_html:
@davidsoergel I agree, dask is less important than other data feeders (NumPy/pandas/iterators). Most data is small data, and flexibility is more important than supporting any particular engine.

I do think it would be interesting to support, though, because it offers similar (but more mature) out of core and distributed dataframe/array functionality to that envisioned with learn.DataFrame.

body:
@davidsoergel I agree, dask is less important than other data feeders (NumPy/pandas/iterators). Most data is small data, and flexibility is more important than supporting any particular engine.

I do think it would be interesting to support, though, because it offers similar (but more mature) out of core and distributed dataframe/array functionality to that envisioned with learn.DataFrame.
